titleStmt.title: Ophthalmos aplois or the single eye, entituled the vision of God wherein is infolded the mistery of divine presence, so to be in one place finitely in apperance, as yet in every place no lesse present, and whilst Hee is here, Hee is universally every where infinitely himselfe. Penned by that learned Dr. Cusanus, and published for the good of the saints. By Giles Randall.
De visione Dei. English.
titleStmt.author: Nicholas, of Cusa, Cardinal, 1401-1464.
Randall, Giles.

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed for John Streater, at the signe of the Bible in Budge-Row,

notesStmt.note: A translation of: De visione Dei.
The first two words of the title are in Greek letters.
With blank leaf A1 and a final blank leaf.
Reproduction of the original in the British Library.

place.placeName: the signe of the Bible in Budge-Row
